segment.source: Reset a Windows 10 Mobile device (Windows 10)
segment.target: Reset a Windows 10 Mobile device (Windows 10)

segment.source: There are two methods for resetting a Windows 10 Mobile device factory reset and \ 0034;wipe and persist \ 0034; reset.
segment.target: There are two methods for resetting a Windows 10 Mobile device factory reset and \ 0034;wipe and persist \ 0034; reset.

segment.source: Reset a Windows 10 Mobile device
segment.target: Reset a Windows 10 Mobile device

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: There are two methods for resetting a Windows 10 Mobile device: factory reset and "wipe and persist" reset.
segment.target: There are two methods for resetting a Windows 10 Mobile device: factory reset and "wipe and persist" reset.

segment.source: Factory reset restores the state of the device back to its first-boot state plus any update packages.
segment.target: Factory reset restores the state of the device back to its first-boot state plus any update packages.

segment.source: The reset will not return device to the original factory state.
segment.target: The reset will not return device to the original factory state.

segment.source: To return the device to the original factory state, you must flash it with the original factory image.All the provisioning applied to the device by the enterprise will be lost and will need to be re-applied if needed.
segment.target: To return the device to the original factory state, you must flash it with the original factory image.All the provisioning applied to the device by the enterprise will be lost and will need to be re-applied if needed.

segment.source: For details on what is removed or persists, see Resetting a mobile device.
segment.target: For details on what is removed or persists, see Resetting a mobile device.

segment.source: "Wipe and persist" reset preserves all the provisioning applied to the device before the reset.
segment.target: "Wipe and persist" reset preserves all the provisioning applied to the device before the reset.

segment.source: After the "wipe and persist" reset, all the preserved provisioning packages are automatically applied on the device and the data in the enterprise shared storage folder DataSharedDataEnterprisePersistent is restored in that folder.
segment.target: After the "wipe and persist" reset, all the preserved provisioning packages are automatically applied on the device and the data in the enterprise shared storage folder DataSharedDataEnterprisePersistent is restored in that folder.

segment.source: For more information on the enterprise shared storage folder, see EnterpriseExtFileSystem CSP.
segment.target: For more information on the enterprise shared storage folder, see EnterpriseExtFileSystem CSP.

segment.source: You can trigger a reset using your mobile device management (MDM) service, or a user can trigger a reset in the user interface (UI) or by using hardware buttons.
segment.target: You can trigger a reset using your mobile device management (MDM) service, or a user can trigger a reset in the user interface (UI) or by using hardware buttons.

segment.source: Reset using MDM
segment.target: Reset using MDM

segment.source: The remote wipe command is sent as an XML provisioning file to the device.
segment.target: The remote wipe command is sent as an XML provisioning file to the device.

segment.source: Since the RemoteWipe configuration service provider (CSP) uses OMA DM and WAP, authentication between client and server and delivery of the XML provisioning file is handled by provisioning.
segment.target: Since the RemoteWipe configuration service provider (CSP) uses OMA DM and WAP, authentication between client and server and delivery of the XML provisioning file is handled by provisioning.

segment.source: The remote wipe command is implemented on the device by using the ResetPhone function.
segment.target: The remote wipe command is implemented on the device by using the ResetPhone function.

segment.source: For more information about the data that is removed as a result of the remote wipe command, see Resetting a mobile device.
segment.target: For more information about the data that is removed as a result of the remote wipe command, see Resetting a mobile device.

segment.source: To perform a factory reset, restoring the device back to its out-of-box state, use the following syncML.
segment.target: To perform a factory reset, restoring the device back to its out-of-box state, use the following syncML.

segment.source: To perform a "wipe and persist" reset, preserving the provisioning applied to the device before the reset and persisting data files locally, use the following syncML.
segment.target: To perform a "wipe and persist" reset, preserving the provisioning applied to the device before the reset and persisting data files locally, use the following syncML.

segment.source: Reset using the UI
segment.target: Reset using the UI

segment.source: On your mobile device, go to SettingsSystemAboutReset your Phone
segment.target: On your mobile device, go to SettingsSystemAboutReset your Phone

segment.source: When you tap Reset your phone, the dialog box will present an option to Also remove provisioned content if:
segment.target: When you tap Reset your phone, the dialog box will present an option to Also remove provisioned content if:

segment.source: At least one provisioning package has been applied, or
segment.target: At least one provisioning package has been applied, or

segment.source: A file is present in the enterprise shared storage folder DataSharedDataEnterprisePersistent.
segment.target: A file is present in the enterprise shared storage folder DataSharedDataEnterprisePersistent.

segment.source: If the option to Also remove provisioned content is selected, the reset that ensues is a regular factory reset.
segment.target: If the option to Also remove provisioned content is selected, the reset that ensues is a regular factory reset.

segment.source: If the option is not selected, a "wipe and persist" reset is performed.
segment.target: If the option is not selected, a "wipe and persist" reset is performed.

segment.source: Reset using hardware buttons
segment.target: Reset using hardware buttons

segment.source: If your phone is unresponsive and you can't reach Settings, you may be able to reset your phone using the hardware buttons.
segment.target: If your phone is unresponsive and you can't reach Settings, you may be able to reset your phone using the hardware buttons.

segment.source: Reset using hardware buttons does not give you the option to persist provisioned content.
segment.target: Reset using hardware buttons does not give you the option to persist provisioned content.

segment.source: On Lumia phones (and some others), do the following to reset your phone:
segment.target: On Lumia phones (and some others), do the following to reset your phone:

segment.source: Press and hold the Volume down and Power buttons at the same time until you feel a vibration (about 10–15 seconds).
segment.target: Press and hold the Volume down and Power buttons at the same time until you feel a vibration (about 10–15 seconds).

segment.source: When you feel the vibration, release the buttons, and then immediately press and hold the Volume down button until you see a large exclamation mark.
segment.target: When you feel the vibration, release the buttons, and then immediately press and hold the Volume down button until you see a large exclamation mark.

segment.source: When the exclamation mark appears, press the following four buttons in this order: Volume up, Volume down, Power, Volume down.
segment.target: When the exclamation mark appears, press the following four buttons in this order: Volume up, Volume down, Power, Volume down.

segment.source: Your phone should now reset and restart itself.
segment.target: Your phone should now reset and restart itself.

segment.source: (It might take a while for the reset to finish.)
segment.target: (It might take a while for the reset to finish.)
